resources.string:
Hi! My name is Kirill. 
I'm an IT student at Lambton College. 

This is my solution for Developer Intern test task. I solve it in 3 ways. 
1) Greedy Algorithm. Fast and result satisfies the conditions. 
2) Genetic Algorithm. Can be limited in time manually (that is why it calculates pretty long time) but it's less dependent on input data than Greedy one, pretty accurate. 
3) Harmonic Algorithm. Faster than Genetic one, but way more dependent on input data. Doesn't realy work with these diverse items. 

Thanks for that task! I had a great time solving it during New Year break.
